thread.title: Beautiful in burgundy! Duchess of Cambridge visits Wales for Action for Children projects
thread.title_full: Beautiful in burgundy! Duchess of Cambridge visits Wales for Action for Children projects

title: Beautiful in burgundy! Duchess of Cambridge visits Wales for Action for Children projects
text: Beautiful in burgundy! Duchess of Cambridge visits Wales for Action for Children projects Beautiful in burgundy! Duchess of Cambridge visits Wales for Action for Children projects THE Duchess of Cambridge has visited Wales for her first engagements with Action for Children since becoming the charity's patron. PUBLISHED: 00:01, Wed, Feb 22, 2017 | UPDATED: 13:03, Wed, Feb 22, 2017 The Duchess became patron of the charity, which cares for disadvantaged children from across the UK, in December - following on from the Queen who stepped down from a number of her patronages. The organisation helps all types of families, supporting children and carers through fostering and adoption and intervening early to stop neglect and abuse. It also aims to make life better for children with disabilities. GETTY The Duchess became patron of the charity in December Related articles THIS is Kate Middleton’s ‘Botox’ skin saviour A spokesman for the Duchess: "The Duchess of Cambridge is incredibly proud to follow Her Majesty The Queen as Patron of Action for Children. "The Duchess firmly believes that every child who needs it should be given the best support at the earliest opportunity, and is pleased to support their important work. GETTY The charity cares for disadvantaged children from across the UK "She is looking forward to getting to know the people that make Action for Children such a success and meeting the young people they work with." In total, 7,000 staff and volunteers operate more than 600 services, improving the lives of 390,000 children, teenagers, parents and carers each year. Kate previously visited Action for Children programmes at Cape Hill Children's Centre in Smethwick in 2015. GETTY Kate previously visited Action for Children programmes at Cape Hill Children's Centre During her visit, she saw two of the successful projects in Wales, where the charity helped 13,000 children and young people last year. She first visited Torfaen to see MIST, a child and adolescent mental health project which has been running for 12 years. The service works with both young people and their carers or birth families to address complex mental health needs. GETTY The organisation also aims to make life better for children with disabilities Kate, Duchess of Cambridge in pictures Wed, February 22, 2017 Kate Middleton, Duchess of Cambridge, life in pictures; including royal visits around the world and her most stunning outfits. Getty Images 1 of 386 Catherine, Duchess of Cambridge arrives during her visit to MIST, a child and adolescent mental health project, part of Action for Children which supports vulnerable families in Wales and across the UK The Duchess then visited the Caerphilly Family Intervention Team (FIT) where she learned about their work with children with emotional and behavioural difficulties, problems with family relationships and those who have or who are likely to self harm. She then viewed the team's family therapy work, which helps families understand the reasons behind certain behaviour. The project is delivered by family support practitioners who are trained and supervised by a clinical psychologist and systemic psychotherapist. Related articles
